strings.hf.title: Saint-Cendre Hospital — File 0
strings.hf.tagline: The corridors move. The files know you. And someone is still on call.
strings.hf.s01.title: The Gate
strings.hf.s01.body: The gate is locked, but the chain hangs down, as if it was cut recently. Beyond it, the hospital swallows the night. A neon light flickers every other second.
strings.hf.s02.title: The Cut Chain
strings.hf.s02.body: The chain on the ground is warm. No fresh rust, no dust on it. As if it was just placed there.
strings.hf.s03.title: The Recent Sign
strings.hf.s03.body: Under the old “CLOSED”, a new sheet: “EXPECTED PATIENT — AUTOMATIC ADMISSION”. Your last name is typed at the bottom. No first name.
strings.hf.s03.c1: Take a photo of the paper
strings.hf.s03.c3: Step back… then try again (you can’t)
strings.hf.s04.title: No Signal
strings.hf.s04.body: Your phone shows zero bars. Then the screen lights up by itself: “On-call service: present”. You look up. A window on the second floor just went dark.
strings.hf.s04.c3: Stare at the window until it makes sense
strings.hf.s05.title: The Lobby
strings.hf.s05.body: The air smells of warm chlorine. The tiles are wet in the middle, like someone just mopped. Everything is too clean for a place that’s shut down.
strings.hf.s05.c3: Step back outside (the night feels thicker)
strings.hf.s06.title: Reception Desk
strings.hf.s06.body: A bell, an open register, a printed paper badge… dated today. The computer screen shows a blinking cursor: “FILE: IN PROGRESS”.
strings.hf.s06.c3: Try the elevator at the back
strings.hf.s07.title: Main Corridor
strings.hf.s07.body: The corridor stretches like a line drawn too straight. All the doors are identical. At the end, a sign: “CLINICS”, and farther: “STAIRWELL — LEVEL -1”.
strings.hf.s08.title: Intercom
strings.hf.s08.body: The bell rings. A second later, the intercom crackles: “You’re late. Present your wristband.” You don’t have a wristband.
strings.hf.s09.title: Admissions Register
strings.hf.s09.body: Your name is already written there, the ink dry. Room 14. Next line: “Wristband to collect.” A pen-drawn arrow points toward the rooms.
strings.hf.s09.c1: Sign as if this is normal
strings.hf.s09.c3: Ignore it and go back to the corridor
strings.hf.s10.title: “Patient” Badge
strings.hf.s10.body: A printer spits out a paper badge: “PATIENT — ON CALL”. It lists your height, your weight… accurate numbers. Too accurate.
strings.hf.s11.title: Room 14
strings.hf.s11.body: The bed is unmade, the pillow side still warm. On the bedside table: a patient wristband. The heart monitor is off, but its LEDs breathe slowly.
strings.hf.s11.c1: Take the wristband from the table
strings.hf.s12.title: Warm Wristband
strings.hf.s12.body: The wristband has your name on it. When you touch it, you feel a pulse-like jolt in the plastic.
strings.hf.s13.title: The Frozen Elevator
strings.hf.s13.body: The elevator doors are ajar onto darkness. The “-1” button is gouged, like someone tried to rip it off. A metallic smell leaks from the cabin.
strings.hf.s14.title: Radiology
strings.hf.s14.body: The machine is in standby. A screen shows an image already loaded, as if it was waiting for you. The hum is too steady to be just equipment.
strings.hf.s14.c1: Look at the image on the screen
strings.hf.s15.title: Impossible Scan
strings.hf.s15.body: The scan shows a chest… and, in the center, a dark rectangle: the exact shape of a cardboard file. At the bottom, a stamp: “PATIENT 0 — ARCHIVES”.
strings.hf.s15.c3: Turn on the lights to check (they flicker)
strings.hf.s16.title: The Chapel
strings.hf.s16.body: In a niche, three candles still burn, wax fresh. A prayer notebook lies open on a blank page, except for one line: “ON CALL = YOU”.
strings.hf.s16.c2: Follow the silence toward an office
strings.hf.s17.title: “Clinics” Door
strings.hf.s17.body: A white door with a scanner. On the scanner screen: “PRESENT WRISTBAND”. Behind the door, you hear a cart rolling slowly.
strings.hf.s17.c1: Pass the wristband over the scanner
strings.hf.s18.title: Doctor’s Office
strings.hf.s18.body: The office is tidy—too tidy. A recorder sits in the center, a cassette inside. A note: “Do not let the patient leave without proof.”
strings.hf.s19.title: The Sliding Corridor
strings.hf.s19.body: The moment you cross the threshold, the corridor isn’t the same. An intersection appears where there used to be a wall. The neon lights shift, like teeth.
strings.hf.s19.c1: Mark the wall (to keep your bearings)
strings.hf.s20.title: Stairwell
strings.hf.s20.body: A sign reads “Level -1”. The air rising from below is damp and cold. It feels like someone is breathing in the staircase.
strings.hf.s20.c2: Go back up to the corridor
strings.hf.s21.title: Level -1
strings.hf.s21.body: Pipes drip. At the end, a door marked “SECURITY”. Farther, another: “SURVEILLANCE”. The light seems to come from the floor.
strings.hf.s22.title: Security Post
strings.hf.s22.body: The screens are black, but the fan is spinning. On a hook: access cards. On the wall, an evacuation plan with an exit to the inner courtyard.
strings.hf.s23.title: Evacuation Plan
strings.hf.s23.body: The plan indicates: “EXIT — INNER COURTYARD”. A marker note says: “No proof, back to the OR.” You can tell it was written for you.
strings.hf.s24.title: “Archives” Door
strings.hf.s24.body: A gray door with a badge reader. The label is new: “PATIENT 0”. As if the hospital adds signs while you walk.
strings.hf.s24.c3: Go back to the evacuation plan
strings.hf.s25.title: Archives
strings.hf.s25.body: Tall shelves. Boxes. Files. And on a table, a binder open to a blank page. The dust is punctured by recent fingerprints.
strings.hf.s26.title: Breathing Files
strings.hf.s26.body: The files are swollen, as if they’re taking in air. Each time you inhale, a binder lifts ever so slightly.
strings.hf.s27.title: Your Name, Typed
strings.hf.s27.body: You finally find it: “PATIENT 0”. On the label: your last name. Under it, a date… tomorrow. The cardboard is cold, despite the damp air.
strings.hf.s28.title: Surveillance Room
strings.hf.s28.body: The screens show the corridors. On one, you see yourself… but one second late. The delay is perfect, like a heartbeat.
strings.hf.s28.c3: Go back to the evacuation plan
strings.hf.s29.title: Backtracking
strings.hf.s29.body: You marked the wall. But the mark isn’t in the right place anymore: it’s on a door. And that door wasn’t there.
strings.hf.s30.title: Operating Room
strings.hf.s30.body: The OR is lit. The lamps warm the air softly. The table is ready, draped, as if an intervention is imminent. But there’s no one here.
strings.hf.s31.title: Instrument Tray
strings.hf.s31.body: The instruments are lined up. A pair of gloves rests on the edge, still glossy, like it was just unwrapped.
strings.hf.s31.c2: Take the gloves and step back
strings.hf.s32.title: Recovery Room
strings.hf.s32.body: You find yourself behind a curtain. A discreet beep follows you. On your wrist, a smear of adhesive… like a sensor was torn off.
strings.hf.s32.c3: Fall back asleep for one second
strings.hf.s33.title: Gurney Corridor
strings.hf.s33.body: Gurneys line the wall. One of them shifts ever so slightly on its own, as if an invisible weight just settled onto it.
strings.hf.s34.title: Changing Rooms
strings.hf.s34.body: Lockers. Gowns. And in a half-open locker, a badge with an unreadable name. You hear a pen writing behind a door.
strings.hf.s34.c3: Go back to the gurney corridor
strings.hf.s35.title: Waste Room
strings.hf.s35.body: Black bags. Bleach smell. A metal door: “MORGUE”. A hatch in the floor might lead back to the archives.
strings.hf.s35.c2: Go through the hatch (back to archives)
strings.hf.s36.title: Morgue
strings.hf.s36.body: The light is too white. The metal drawers are closed… except one, barely ajar. A cold breath leaks out.
strings.hf.s36.c2: Step back and close the door
strings.hf.s36.c3: Pick up the wall phone (it’s ringing)
strings.hf.s37.title: Patient 0 File
strings.hf.s37.body: Inside the drawer: a cardboard file. No body. Just your file, placed like a parcel. On the first page: “STATUS: IN PROGRESS”.
strings.hf.s38.title: The Page That Types Itself
strings.hf.s38.body: Before your eyes, a line types itself: “The patient is reading this. He thinks he’s alone.” The next sentence starts… then stops when you hold your breath.
strings.hf.s38.c1: Close it and run for the exit
strings.hf.s39.title: The Exit Door
strings.hf.s39.body: An “EXIT” door with a panic bar. On the other side: cold air. But also… a very faint keyboard sound.
strings.hf.s39.c1: Push the bar and go out
strings.hf.s39.c3: Press your ear to the door and listen
strings.hf.s40.title: Inner Courtyard
strings.hf.s40.body: You’re outside, in the courtyard. The walls are too high. The gated exit to the street is there… but the lock looks new, shiny.
strings.hf.s41.title: Outside Air
strings.hf.s41.body: You breathe. The air is real. Too real. Then your phone buzzes: “Reminder: consultation in progress.” You never booked anything.
strings.hf.s41.c1: Force the gate to the street
strings.hf.s41.c3: Look up at the second-floor windows
strings.hf.s42.title: The Worker
strings.hf.s42.body: At the far end of the corridor, seen through a glass door, someone passes in a gown. You can’t see their face. They push a cart. As if the night watch never stopped.
strings.hf.s43.title: The “Consultation”
strings.hf.s43.body: The gown turns. Still no face—just a blurred patch. A clear voice: “The patient must present.” The OR table is waiting for you.
strings.hf.s44.title: Set-Up
strings.hf.s44.body: You feel straps. The beep gets louder. Somewhere, a sentence appears: “No proof, back to the OR.” You search for your breathing.
strings.hf.s45.title: Proof
strings.hf.s45.body: You’re holding proof. Audio, video, or the file. Something that says: “This place lies.” The security screens crackle like they hate it.
strings.hf.s46.title: Validation
strings.hf.s46.body: Behind a door with no handle: an office. A computer types by itself. On screen: “PATIENT 0 — STATUS: TO ASSIGN”. A “VALIDATED” stamp waits, ink still fresh.
strings.hf.s47.title: The Final Choice
strings.hf.s47.body: The gate to the street is in front of you. One last time, you hear the keyboard. Like the hospital is waiting for you to choose your ending.
strings.hf.s48.title: Last Corridor
strings.hf.s48.body: You walk toward the gate. The metal is cold. Behind you, the courtyard door starts to close slowly, without a sound. The air seems to hold back its sentence.
strings.hf.s48.c1: Push the gate and don’t look back
strings.hf.end_good.title: End — Exit (with proof)
strings.hf.end_good.body: You pass through the gate. Dawn bites your lungs. Behind you, the hospital stays still… too still. In your hand, the proof weighs like a warm stone. When you check your photo/recording, the timestamp doesn’t exist.
strings.hf.end_bad.title: End — Back to the OR
strings.hf.end_bad.body: The ceiling light devours your eyes. The beep becomes a single note. Someone types somewhere: “Patient presented. On-call validated.” And you understand: here, the exit was never a door.
strings.hf.end_secret.title: Secret End — Assignment
strings.hf.end_secret.body: The stamp slams down. “VALIDATED.” The screen reads: “On-call staff: active.” The keyboard stops. The door shuts. And in the silence, you feel the place finally breathe… because you took over.
strings.hf.clue.has_bracelet.title: Patient Wristband
strings.hf.clue.has_bracelet.desc: A warm wristband, like someone just fastened it onto you.
strings.hf.clue.has_keycard.title: Access Card
strings.hf.clue.has_keycard.desc: A staff magnetic card. It opens doors that shouldn’t work anymore.
strings.hf.clue.has_tape.title: On-Call Cassette
strings.hf.clue.has_tape.desc: A recorder cassette: a voice notes shift times… and your name.
strings.hf.clue.has_recording.title: CCTV Recording
strings.hf.clue.has_recording.desc: Video proof: the corridor moves while the camera doesn’t.
strings.hf.clue.has_dossier.title: Patient 0 File
strings.hf.clue.has_dossier.desc: Your file. It fills itself in as you breathe.
strings.hf.h.s12.soft: You have something the hospital can “recognize” now.
strings.hf.h.s12.strong: The wristband opens/alters doors and makes the secret route possible.
strings.hf.h.s18.soft: The recorder isn’t there by accident.
strings.hf.h.s18.strong: Take the cassette: it counts as proof and for the secret ending.
strings.hf.h.s22.soft: What still works is often kept in Security.
strings.hf.h.s22.strong: Take the access card: it unlocks archives, surveillance, and the OR.
strings.hf.h.s28.soft: If you can prove the corridor moves, you can break the loop.
strings.hf.h.s28.strong: Start the recording: without proof, some exits will send you back to the OR.
strings.hf.h.s37.soft: The file is about you more than you think.
strings.hf.h.s37.strong: Take the file: it’s the strongest proof, and a key to the full truth.
strings.hf.h.s47.soft: You can finish fast… or go deeper.
strings.hf.h.s47.strong: Secret end = wristband + card + cassette + recording + file.
